item.title: Seven Guns for the MacGregors
item.description: Seven Guns for the MacGregors is a Technicolor 1966 Italian spaghetti western. It is the directorial debut film of Franco Giraldi, who was Sergio Leone's assistant in A Fistful of Dollars. The film gained a great commercial success and generated an immediate sequel, Up the MacGregors! (1967), again directed by Giraldi, and a later sequel, More Dollars for the MacGregors (1970).

item.title: Pecos Cleans Up
item.description: Pecos è qui: prega e muori is a 1967 Italian Spaghetti Western film directed by Maurizio Lucidi.

item.title: The Belle Starr Story
item.description: The Belle Starr Story/Il mio corpo per un poker is a 1968 Italian made episodic Bonnie and Clyde type spaghetti western co-written and co-directed by Lina Wertmüller and starring Elsa Martinelli who also sings the title song. It is the only spaghetti western directed by a woman and one of the few which stars a woman in the title role. Wertmüller replaced after a few days Piero Cristofani, who was at his directorial debut.

item.title: My Name Is Pecos
item.description: Due once di piombo is a 1967 Italian Spaghetti Western film directed by Maurizio Lucidi.

item.title: Los Pistoleros de Arizona
item.description: Five Thousand Dollars on One Ace is a 1964 Spanish, Italian and West German Spaghetti Western film directed by Alfonso Balcázar.

item.title: La taglia è tua... l'uomo l'ammazzo io
item.description: The Reward's Yours... The Man's Mine is a 1969 Italian Spaghetti Western film directed by Edoardo Mulargia.

item.title: White Fang and the Hunter
item.description: Zanna Bianca e il cacciatore solitario is a 1975 Italian adventure film directed by Alfonso Brescia. Despite the title tries to market the commercial success of Lucio Fulci's White Fang, the film's plot has no connection with the novel. The film was poorly received by critics, being defined as "pathetic" and marked as "trash", and gained some cult status in reason of its reputation.

item.title: L'uomo che viene da Canyon City
item.description: Man from Canyon City is a 1965 Spanish-Italian Spaghetti Western film directed by Alfonso Balcázar.

item.title: Gatling Gun
item.description: Gatling Gun is a 1968 Italian-Spanish Spaghetti Western film directed by Paolo Bianchini and starring Robert Woods.

item.title: Savage Guns
item.description: Savage Guns is a low-budget spaghetti western from 1971, directed by Demofilo Fidani and starring Robert Woods.
